decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to control the game through countering spells and removing threats while utilizing Dragonlord Ojutai as the commander. The deck includes a wide range of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw options to maintain control of the battlefield. Cards like Force of Will, Mana Leak, and Path to Exile help disrupt opponents' plans, while powerful creatures like Vendilion Clique and Consecrated Sphinx provide additional advantages. The inclusion of mana accelerants like Celestial Colonnade and Tundra ensures that the deck can handle any situation efficiently. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining a strong board presence while stifling opponents' actions to secure victory.

This deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a fast and aggressive strategy using Anafenza, the Foremost as the commander. The deck includes a variety of mana ramp creatures like Birds of Paradise and Elves of Deep Shadow to accelerate the play of larger threats. The deck also features disruptive creatures like Aven Mindcensor and Tidehollow Sculler to control the opponent's resources. Removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Abrupt Decay help deal with opposing threats, while powerful cards like Armageddon and Umezawa's Jitte provide additional advantages. The deck focuses on applying early pressure, disrupting opponents' game plans, and maintaining control of the battlefield to secure victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures and land destruction to control the board and pressure opponents. Radha, Heir to Keld allows for ramping and additional mana to cast threats quickly. The deck includes various mana acceleration creatures like Fyndhorn Elves and Birds of Paradise, alongside powerful creatures such as Gaea's Revenge and Inferno Titan. Land destruction spells like Stone Rain and Goblin Settler disrupt opponents' mana base, while aggressive creatures like Goblin Ruinblaster and Flametongue Kavu deal damage efficiently. The deck also includes utility cards like Sylvan Library and Survival of the Fittest to provide card advantage and tutor for key creatures. Overall, the deck aims to establish early board presence and disrupt opponents' game plan effectively.

The deck revolves around graveyard manipulation and combo potential. It aims to fill the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Buried Alive and Survival of the Fittest, then reanimate them using spells like Reanimate and Necromancy. The Mimeoplasm serves as a versatile commander, able to copy and combine different creatures in the graveyard for devastating effects. The deck also includes a strong control package with counterspells and removal spells to protect the combo and disrupt opponents. The mana base is optimized for consistency and includes a variety of lands to ensure access to all necessary colors. Overall, the deck seeks to assemble its combo pieces quickly and efficiently to outpace and overwhelm opponents.

This deck revolves around the commander, Yisan, the Wanderer Bard, to tutor for powerful creatures and ramp up mana quickly. The deck features a high density of mana dorks, such as Birds of Paradise and Llanowar Elves, to accelerate the board state and enable explosive plays. It includes key utility creatures like Eternal Witness and Acidic Slime to disrupt opponents and protect its own game plan. With cards like Primeval Titan and Craterhoof Behemoth as finishers, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of powerful creatures and close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Garruk, Caller of Beasts and Birthing Pod provide additional ways to find key creatures and maintain board presence.
